response_requirements.initial_response_description: Records available during reasonable office hours; must furnish copy upon request without specific deadline
response_requirements.final_response_notes: No specific statutory deadline; records must be available during reasonable office hours

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: May charge up to $25/hour for locating records (excluding first hour) if search exceeds one hour
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: Up to $0.25 per impression or actual per-page cost of copying equipment, whichever is greater
fee_structure.deposit_requirement: May require deposit up to 50% of estimated fee

exemptions.description: Attorney-client privileged communications and attorney work product
Records that would constitute clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy
Records prohibited from disclosure by state or federal law
Trade secrets, proprietary, commercial, or financial information privileged or confidential
Test questions, scoring keys, and examination data
Personal contact information in personnel records

appeal_process.first_level_notes: Person denied access may apply to district court in county where record is located for order compelling disclosure
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court shall award reasonable attorney fees and costs to prevailing party

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: Public entity may not ask for motive/reason for requesting records or identity of person requesting
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Initial request need not be in person or in writing; may request written clarification to identify specific records
requester_requirements.specific_format: No specific format required; may be verbal or written

agency_obligations.records_officer_notes: Must post name and phone of contact person authorized to provide access if no regular office hours
agency_obligations.response_format_options: May provide in electronic form as maintained; copy must be mailed upon request
agency_obligations.no_record_creation_required: Not required to create record, compile information, perform legal research, or provide legal analysis

primary_sources: North Dakota Constitution Article XI, Section 6
validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official North Dakota statute. Constitutional foundation in Article XI, Section 6 (1977). No specific response deadline - records available during reasonable office hours. Up to $0.25/page for copies, $25/hour for search time after first hour. May require 50% deposit. Public entity may not ask for identity or purpose. District court enforcement with mandatory attorney fees to prevailing party. Constitutional presumption that all government records are public unless otherwise provided by law.
